subject: Re: [Read_Alphabet] Re: Unicode proposal again.
msgSnippet: ...  is pronounced /k/ /s/ /ts/ /dZ/ / / /tS/ (off the top of my head) in various orthographies. If Shavian  is used for a vowel in QS, that s an
messageBody:
At 18:20 +0100 2007-05-29, amd64_hacker wrote:
>It seems to me that unless the glyphs and sound of two characters
>are identical they are not the same letter.

<c> is pronounced /k/ /s/ /ts/ /dZ/ /'/ /tS/ (off the top of my head)
in various orthographies. If Shavian <m> is used for a vowel in QS,
that's an orthographic difference, not one of character identity.

>Also I didn't consider alternate glyph forms in that list but they
>should be taken into account since they alter the behaviour of a
>character which is worse.

Eh?
--
Michael Everson * http://www.evertype.com
